section.title: Adding a Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager Provider
section.para: After initial installation and creation of a CloudForms Management Engine environment, add a Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager provider to the appliance.

step.para:
Click
(Configuration), then click
(Add a New Infrastructure Provider).
Enter the Name of the provider to add. The Name is how the device is labeled in the console.
Select Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager from the Type list.
Enter the Host Name (or IPv4 or IPv6 address) of the provider.

important.para: The Host Name must use a unique fully qualified domain name.

step.para: Enter the API Port if your provider uses a non-standard port for access.
Select the appropriate Zone for the provider. By default, the zone is set to default.
In the Credentials area, under Default, provide the login credentials required for the Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager administrative user:

listitem.para: Enter the user name, admin@internal, in the User ID field.
Enter the user password in the Password field.
Confirm the user password in the Verify Password field.
Click Validate to confirm that the CloudForms Management Engine can connect to the Manager using the user name and password.

step.para: In the Credentials area, under C & U Database, provide the login credentials for the CloudForms user of the Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Data Warehouse database:

note.para: To obtain historical Capacity and Utilization (C & U) data for Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager, you must create a CloudForms Management Engine user in the already-configured Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Data Warehouse database. To create the user, see . For information on setting up the Data Warehouse service on the Manager, see the Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Installation Guide.

listitem.para: Enter the database user name in the User ID field.
Enter the user password in the Password field.
Confirm the user password in the Verify Password field.
Click Validate to confirm that the CloudForms Management Engine can connect to the database using the user name and password.
